events.event_description: U.S. wholesale power prices are forecast to average $40 per megawatthour in 2025, up 7% from 2024, with most regions seeing increases except Texas and Northwest.
events.citation: We forecast that the 11 wholesale prices we track in STEO will average $40 per megawatthour (MWh) in 2025 (weighted by demand), up 7% from 2024.

events.event_description: Natural gas prices for power generators are expected to rise 24% to $3.37 per million British thermal units in 2025 compared to 2024.
events.citation: We expect that the cost of natural gas delivered to U.S. power generators will average $3.37 per million British thermal units in 2025, which is up 24% from last year's average but is about the same price as in 2023.

events.event_description: The Northwest region expects 20% more hydropower generation in 2025 despite ongoing drought conditions.
events.citation: The Northwest region is still experiencing drought conditions, but we expect conditions to improve slightly this year with 20% more hydropower generation.

events.event_description: Southwest and California regions are forecast to see the largest wholesale price increases of 30-35% in 2025.
events.citation: We expect the largest increases (about 30%–35%) will occur in the Southwest and California regions.

events.event_description: U.S. residential electricity prices are projected to average 16.8 cents per kilowatthour in 2025, representing a 2% increase from 2024.
events.citation: We expect U.S. retail electricity prices for residential customers will average 16.8 cents per kilowatthour, which would be 2% more than in 2024.
